definition: the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)

sentences.english: Abundant kidney-yin nourishes the organs in the body.
sentences.chinese: 肾阴足，肌体各脏腑组织器官得到滋养。

sentences.english: This makes it easier to get viral and bacterial infections.
sentences.chinese: 肌体更容易感染滤过性病毒和细菌病毒。

sentences.english: Abundant kidney-yang warms and promotes all the viscera and organs.
sentences.chinese: 肾阳足，肌体各脏腑组织器官得以温平和推动。

sentences.english: Wholly improve your human body from inner to outside, and purge harmful free radical.
sentences.chinese: 由内而外全面改善您的肌体，清除体内的有害自由基。

sentences.english: Acute dysentery wracked and sapped life from his body.
sentences.chinese: 急性痢疾严重伤害了他的肌体。

sentences.english: When a person is running they are putting their body under stress.
sentences.chinese: 当人们奔跑时，他们的肌体便处于紧张状态。

sentences.english: Corruption is a kind of "corrosive", damaging to the state and the Party.
sentences.chinese: 腐败现象是一种腐蚀剂，严重侵蚀着党和国家的肌体。

sentences.english: The counteractive ability lowest of the human body when sleeping because of the person, fall ill very easily.
sentences.chinese: 因为人在睡觉时肌体的抵抗能力最低，很容易生病。

sentences.english: A low concentration of oxygen-carrying red cells robs the body of energy-releasing oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 携氧红血球数量少会使肌体失去释放能量的氧气。

sentences.english: The organism tries to counter with free radical production.
sentences.chinese: 肌体通过产生自由基来对抗衰老。
